Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
The campus is EXTREMELY safe. I have never heard of any violence or bad activity happening on campus.
They have many fraternities and sororities on campus for everyone.
There are many clubs and activities, ones for every types of students.
It is great for every type of student.
The beginning of every school year they have a foam party for everyone.
Well personally all colleges are too expensive these days, but that is just a personal opinion. This a very good college so I would have to say you get what you pay for.
There are many things that you can do for fun on campus and many campus activities. They have free movies on Friday and etc.
Man, SIUE has a mass amount of eating places on campus. You have a sit down restaurant, pizza hut, taco bell, etc.

The dorm life is good and very safe. You have 1 roommate and 4 people to 1 bathroom. There are 3 freshman dorms. My best advice for dorm life is make sure you make friends or it wont be that great of an experience.
It depends on what classes you take. There are some classes that are easy blow off classes, but most of the class are normal academic rigor for college.
Definitely apply here. Make sure you study the suggested amount. Make friends and get involved.
This is a very good school. I really like the atmosphere and the professors. They have very good programs.
pageTitle: SIU Edwardsville (SIUE) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {27252=The food and dining at SIUe are amazing! There are places to eat in many different buildings so it's easy to grab a snack between any classes. SIUe's food and dining include: an Entree's, a pasta bar, nacho bar, potato bar, Deli/Panini/ a Grill, Wok (Chinese), Chick-Fil-A, University Restaurant, Kaldi's, Starbucks, Pizza Hut/Wing Street, Taco Bell, Union Station, Skywalk Food Court, Commons Grill, Woodland Cart, Bluff Cafe, Auntie Ann's, Sweet E's (ice cream), and my personal favorite Freshens. There's also a rumor on campus about a Panara Bread for the 2012-2013 year., 252751=Tuition is only 2900 per semester, with fees it comes around to about 4000 a semester which isn't bad at all for a University. You get a great education for a low tuition cost., 439266=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 334446=Parties and chilling with friends in the dorms. Without a car, you won't be able to enjoy having fun off campus after a certain time of the day because the buses leaving and coming back to campus stop after about 5:00 pm}
textBeforeTable: 06/11/2009 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 38 out of 39 people found this review useful. 1 of 102 Christopher from Bardolph, IL Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. You could win a free scholarship. textAfterTable: Bang for the buck I think I am getting a great education here. Housing is wonderful and the prices are reasonable. Am enjoying being here I love SIUe a lot. I have lived in housing for both my years here and I love it. The Resident Assistants are wonderful and help when you need them. Am learning a lot Classes here at SIUe are challenging. However SIUe is a great place to learn outside of the classroom. Your instructors and professors make it a priority to teach you what you need to know and help get real-life, hands-on experience.
